channel.title: Addicited to Gaming!
channel.description: [center][b]I dont know if you have all noticed but in the news lately the parents of children have been critesizing online multiplayer games because they are too addictive personally i think this is redicilous because they always want to get rid of our fun and rights dont you think so? post all your views about this here[/b][/center]

item.title: Addicited to Gaming!
item.dc:creator: @Harp00nage Harp00nage
item.description:
@Harp00nage wrote:

I Used To Play GuildWars(Rank 5)(I Played for about 6 months)and Empire Earth 2(I got within the top 30 players) But… THen one day my parents took away my comp cuz i got a 3.6 GPA… never seen it since, now i auto on my bros comp, and write scripts on my parents comp ~ ~
(HOping to get it back for christmas)

Read full topic

item.title: Addicited to Gaming!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Because, as we all know, lego promotes excellent social skills.

PS: Buy him a pack of B&H, a 10 bag and a gram of cocaine if you want social skills. Or just stick to the video games.

Read full topic

item.title: Addicited to Gaming!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:12, topic:31375”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=45728.msg559354#msg559354 date=1165105048]

If I had a kid and he sat on a computer all day then I’d force him to go out with his friends.

I have nothing against any parent who limits their childs computer time, as long as it is very reasonable. MMORPG’s are extremely addictive, and they take a big hit on your social life.

Force him? So, he’d have to endure a social life he obviously dosen’t enjoy, rather than have fun?

No, he’d get out and get some exercise so he doesn’t become a pale fat nerd.

I’ll be capping my child’s time, but it’ll be more then reasonable. I just want to make sure that my kid grows up an active life with friends. I couldn’t give a crap if he spent all night on the computer, as long as he goes out every once in a while with friends. Just gotta keep things in moderation.

But yeah, I can see what you mean. My friend only has access to the computer for one hour a day.
[/quote]

I totally agree with you jme. When I have kids, I’m not even going to buy that kid videogames. I’ll buy him something much simpler. Basketball hoop, football, legos or something. But definitely not computer games or video games. Just a total waste of time. Kids don’t realize this now, but when they start growing up, and find out how poor they are in their social skills, that they won’t even be able to survive in most job environments where you need social skills to get promoted or even just to keep your own job.[/quote]

That’s a bit harsh ron. I’ll buy my kid(s) video games. Just limit the time they are aloud and encourage them to go out with friends.

Read full topic

item.title: Addicited to Gaming!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:7, topic:31375”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=45728.msg559182#msg559182 date=1165103052]

If I had a kid and he sat on a computer all day then I’d force him to go out with his friends.

I have nothing against any parent who limits their childs computer time, as long as it is very reasonable. MMORPG’s are extremely addictive, and they take a big hit on your social life.

Force him? So, he’d have to endure a social life he obviously dosen’t enjoy, rather than have fun?
[/quote]

No, he’d get out and get some exercise so he doesn’t become a pale fat nerd.

I’ll be capping my child’s time, but it’ll be more then reasonable. I just want to make sure that my kid grows up an active life with friends. I couldn’t give a crap if he spent all night on the computer, as long as he goes out every once in a while with friends. Just gotta keep things in moderation.

But yeah, I can see what you mean. My friend only has access to the computer for one hour a day.[/quote]

I totally agree with you jme. When I have kids, I’m not even going to buy that kid videogames. I’ll buy him something much simpler. Basketball hoop, football, legos or something. But definitely not computer games or video games. Just a total waste of time. Kids don’t realize this now, but when they start growing up, and find out how poor they are in their social skills, that they won’t even be able to survive in most job environments where you need social skills to get promoted or even just to keep your own job.

Read full topic

I have nothing against any parent who limits their childs computer time, as long as it is very reasonable. MMORPG’s are extremely addictive, and they take a big hit on your social life.
[/quote]

Everyone needs a social life. That’s not being a bad parent thats being a good parent.

Read full topic

item.title: Addicited to Gaming!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

its addictive to some people, but it can be controlled

once i had a really important test, i started studying 3 months before it, you’d think id be playing runescape all that time, but no, i still did 3 hours a day and only played it in my revision breaks
i got a report filled with As

Read full topic
